alert.note: Alert for Hansford; Hutchinson; Moore; Sherman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 8:18PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hutchinson, southern Hansford, southeastern Sherman and eastern Moore Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 818 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Gruver to near Pringle to Lake Meredith. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Borger, Spearman, Fritch, Stinnett, Gruver, Sanford, Morse, Lake Meredith and Pringle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Lake Meredith, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
